item.description:
Darwin's Abominable Mystery
and the
Search
for the
First Flowering Plants


: : :




Lecture by William (Ned) Friedman
Thursday, November 4, 6:00 pm
Free and open to the public.
Geological Lecture Hall, 24 Oxford Street.

: : :

Charles Darwin was baffled by many big questions in evolutionary biology, and none more so than the mystery of how the planetâ€™s first flowering plants came to be. Join William (Ned) Friedman, Professor in the Department of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology at University of Colorado, for an exploration into the evolutionary origin of flowering plants, and how recent advances in the fossil record have shed new light on what they may have looked like, where they "lived," and how they reproduced.
item.name: Darwin's Abominable Mystery
